trends: There have been 12 other sightings in Lansdale
There was one other sighting in Lansdale on or around February 20th 2012
divs: sighting detailsi was letting the dog out around 10:30 pm est. i'm in a quiet residential neighborhood in lansdale, pa. as i often do, i was looking into the night sky while he sniffed around for a good spot to relieve himself. i turned and called him to the other side of the front lawn and was immediately taken back by the enormity of this bright white\orange\yellow object that hung in the sky above the house across the street. i had no idea what it could be! it was shining much brighter - and was clearly larger - than any star i would see from earth. it certainly didn't resemble any flight crafts that i had ever seen either. my first thought was that it could be a flaming meteor that was extremely close to earth's orbit and was perhaps also reflecting the sun; so i watched it more intently to examine its path... but it didn't move at all. i stared at this thing for about 10 seconds, making sure i was stable on my feet to ensure the accuracy of my understanding. but it still didn't move! then, i affixed a line of sight against the tip of a thin naked tree branch that was located across the street. another 10 seconds elapsed and i was able to track only a very slight, slow ascent. during this time, i had also been monitoring the objects light characteristics, searching for signs that it was perhaps just an extraordinarily well lit plane, or helicopter, or balloon - anything that i would otherwise be able to identify. but it was not, by any means, anything i could assume be in the sky this close to a residential area. (note: i was unable to determine with much certainty it's proximity to my location. taking a mathematical guess, i would say it was about 200-400 feet above ground and between 1-2 miles in distance; but then again, i wouldn't be surprised if somehow i learned that it was, in fact, a meteor well outside the earth's atmosphere - but it was much too bright and had so little movement!) anxious to get someone else's perspective, i rushed into the house to bring another set of eyes onto this magnificent object. it had moved so little during my observation that i figured, surely, i could bring my family out one at a time, if i needed. i first grabbed my mother-in-law, who was just in the kitchen, and rushed her outside! not more than 15 seconds passed while i hurried inside and returned to the front yard. but, sure enough, by the time we emerged from the house, this unbelievable object had inexplicably disappeared.
